Class Shipboard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Model.Shipboards.Shipboard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Shipboard extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a Shipboard used in a game to manage components, resources, and their configurations while adhering to specific game rules and constraints. The Shipboard is characterized by a grid of component tiles, a standby area for temporary tile storage, rules for validating its configuration, and methods for managing game mechanics such as scoring, resource management, and tile placement. Fields: - abandoned: Whether the shipboard is in an abandoned state. - daysOnFlight: Number of days the shipboard has been in flight. - color: The color of the shipboard. - nickname: Nickname associated with the shipboard. - componentTilesGrid: The main grid representing the component tiles on the shipboard. - standbyComponent: Temporary storage area for component tiles. - discardedTiles: Count of tiles that have been discarded. - finishedShipboard: Indicates if the shipboard has completed its setup. - rocketPlaced: Whether a rocket is placed on the shipboard. - correctingShip: Tracks if the ship is being corrected. - CosmicCredits: Total credits representing the ship's resources. - bank: The bank with which the shipboard interacts for credit-related operations. - tileInHand: Represents the current tile being handled. - componentTilesGridCopy: A copy of the main component grid for reference or backup. - standbyComponentCopy: A copy of the standby component tiles for reference or backup.
See Also:

      public String getColor()
      Retrieves the color value.
      Returns:
      the color as a String

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Calculates the score for the shipboard based on specific game rules. The score is determined by evaluating the storage compartments of the component tiles and the type and quantity of good blocks contained within them. Additional adjustments are made based on the abandoned state of the ship and the number of discarded tiles.
      Returns:
      the calculated score for the shipboard as an integer

      public String getNickname()
      Retrieves the nickname of the entity.
      Returns:
      the nickname as a String

      public void setNewComponentTilesGrid()
      Replaces the current grid of component tiles with a new instance of ComponentTilesGrid. This method initializes componentTilesGrid by assigning it a new instance of the ComponentTilesGrid class, effectively clearing or resetting any previously set grid contents.

      public Optional<ComponentTile>[] getStandbyComponent()

    • setStandbyComponent

      public void setStandbyComponent(int i, Optional<ComponentTile> standbyComponent)
      Sets the standby component at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      i - the index at which the standby component is to be set
      standbyComponent - the component to set as the standby, wrapped in an Optional

    • setNewStandbyComponent

      public void setNewStandbyComponent()
      Initializes the standbyComponent array with a size of 2, where both elements are set to Optional.empty(). This method is used to reset or prepare the standbyComponent to a default state with no assigned values.

    • weldComponentTile

      public void weldComponentTile(ComponentTile ct, int i, int j)
      Welds a specified component tile to the shipboard at the given grid coordinates. If a component tile is already present at the specified coordinates, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      ct - the component tile to be placed on the grid
      i - the row index of the grid where the component tile will be placed
      j - the column index of the grid where the component tile will be placed
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there is already a component tile present at the specified grid position

    • standbyComponentTile

      public void standbyComponentTile(ComponentTile ct)
      Places a component tile in one of the standby positions, which allows storing up to two component tiles temporarily. If both standby positions are already occupied, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      ct - the component tile to be placed in the standby position
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if both standby positions are already occupied

    • pickStandByComponentTile

      public ComponentTile pickStandByComponentTile(int index)
      Picks a component tile from the standby position at the specified index. If the standby position at the given index is empty, an exception will be thrown. Once the tile is picked, the standby position is set to empty.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the standby position to pick the component tile from
      Returns:
      the component tile picked from the standby position
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the standby position at the specified index is empty

    • destroyTile

      public void destroyTile(int i, int j)
      Destroys a tile located at the specified grid coordinates. If the tile does not exist at the given position, an exception is thrown. In addition to removing the tile, updates adjacent tiles to account for potential changes caused by the removal (e.g., alien addon management).
      Parameters:
      i - the row index of the tile to be destroyed
      j - the column index of the tile to be destroyed
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the specified grid position is empty and there is no tile to destroy

    • isShipboardEmpty

      public boolean isShipboardEmpty()
      Checks if the shipboard is empty by verifying if all Optional tiles in the component grid are empty.
      Returns:
      true if all tiles in the component grid are empty, false if at least one tile is present.

    • checkShipboard

      public boolean checkShipboard()
      Checks the validity of the shipboard configuration based on the placement of components. This method ensures that the components such as engines and cannons meet placement rules, verifies connections between tiles, and ensures all tiles are validated. The validation process includes: - Ensuring engines and cannons are correctly placed without conflicts. - Checking the connectivity of tiles using a recursive validation method. - Ensuring all tiles are assigned a valid color during the validation process.
      Returns:
      true if the shipboard is valid according to the placement and connection rules; false if any validation rule is violated.

    • abandons

      public void abandons()
      Marks an entity or resource as abandoned. This method updates the state of the object by setting the 'abandoned' flag to true, indicating it is no longer in use or has been deliberately relinquished.

    • hasBeenKickedOut

      public boolean hasBeenKickedOut()
      Checks if the entity has been removed or ejected from a group or context.
      Returns:
      true if the entity has been kicked out, false otherwise

    • countExposedConnectors

      public int countExposedConnectors()
      Counts the number of exposed connectors in a grid of component tiles. Connectors are considered exposed if they are not adjacent to another component tile and are not smooth on the respective side.
      Returns:
      the total number of exposed connectors in the grid

    • isRightSideCannon

      public boolean isRightSideCannon(int i)
      Determines if there is a valid cannon on the right side for the given index.
      Parameters:
      i - The index to check in the grid.
      Returns:
      true if a valid cannon exists on the right side, false otherwise.

    • isLeftSideCannon

      public boolean isLeftSideCannon(int i)
      Determines if the given index corresponds to a left-side cannon with strength greater than 0.
      Parameters:
      i - the index to check within the component grid
      Returns:
      true if the index corresponds to a left-side cannon; false otherwise

    • isTopSideCannon

      public boolean isTopSideCannon(int j)
      Determines if there is a top side cannon at the specified column index within the first five rows of the component grid and checks its strength.
      Parameters:
      j - the column index to check for a top side cannon
      Returns:
      true if a top side cannon is found with a strength greater than 0, false otherwise

    • isBottomSideCannon

      public boolean isBottomSideCannon(int j)
      Determines if there is a bottom-side cannon with a strength greater than zero in the column specified by the parameter.
      Parameters:
      j - the column index to check for a bottom-side cannon
      Returns:
      true if a bottom-side cannon with a strength greater than zero is found, false otherwise

    • isRightSideShielded

      public boolean isRightSideShielded()
      Checks if any component tile in the grid has its right side shielded.
      Returns:
      true if at least one component tile is present in the grid and has its right side shielded, otherwise false.

    • isLeftSideShielded

      public boolean isLeftSideShielded()
      Determines if any component tile in the grid has its left side shielded. The method iterates through the grid of optional component tiles and checks if there is any tile present that has its left side shielded.
      Returns:
      true if at least one component tile in the grid has its left side shielded, otherwise false

    • isTopSideShielded

      public boolean isTopSideShielded()
      Determines if the top side of any component tile within the grid is shielded. The method iterates over the grid of component tiles and checks for the presence of a tile where its top side is marked as shielded.
      Returns:
      true if the top side of at least one component tile is shielded; false otherwise

    • isBottomSideShielded

      public boolean isBottomSideShielded()
      Checks if any component tile in the grid has its bottom side shielded. Iterates through the grid of component tiles and determines if there is at least one tile whose bottom side is shielded.
      Returns:
      true if at least one component tile's bottom side is shielded, false otherwise

    • isExposedConnectorOnTop

      public boolean isExposedConnectorOnTop(int numOfColumn)
      Determines whether an exposed connector is present on the top side of the specified column within the grid of component tiles.
      Parameters:
      numOfColumn - the column index to check for an exposed connector on the top side
      Returns:
      true if there is an exposed connector on the top side of the specified column; false if the top side is smooth or there are no components in the column

    • isExposedConnectorOnBottom

      public boolean isExposedConnectorOnBottom(int numOfColumn)
      Determines if there is an exposed connector on the bottom side of the column specified by the given column index in the component tiles grid.
      Parameters:
      numOfColumn - the index of the column to check in the component tiles grid
      Returns:
      true if there is an exposed connector on the bottom side of the specified column, false otherwise

    • isExposedConnectorOnLeft

      public boolean isExposedConnectorOnLeft(int numOfRow)
      Checks if there is an exposed connector on the left side of any component in the specified row of the grid.
      Parameters:
      numOfRow - the row index to check for an exposed connector on the left side
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one component in the specified row with an exposed connector on the left side; false otherwise

    • isExposedConnectorOnRight

      public boolean isExposedConnectorOnRight(int numOfRow)
      Checks if the right side of the first present component in the specified row is an exposed connector.
      Parameters:
      numOfRow - the row index to check within the grid.
      Returns:
      true if the right side of the first present component in the row is an exposed connector; false otherwise.

      public boolean columnEmpty(int numOfColumn)
      Checks if a specific column in the grid is empty.
      Parameters:
      numOfColumn - the index of the column to check
      Returns:
      true if the column is empty, false otherwise

    • rowEmpty

      public boolean rowEmpty(int numOfRow)
      Checks if a specified row in the grid is empty.
      Parameters:
      numOfRow - the index of the row to check
      Returns:
      true if all elements in the specified row are empty, false otherwise

    • thereIsStillCrew

      public boolean thereIsStillCrew()
      Checks if there is still any crew present on the component tiles grid. This method iterates through a collection of tiles to determine if any tile contains a crew with a number greater than zero.
      Returns:
      true if at least one component tile contains a crew with a number greater than zero; false otherwise.

    • thereAreStillBlocks

      public boolean thereAreStillBlocks()
      Checks if there are still blocks available in the component tiles grid. Iterates through the grid and verifies if any present component tile contains good blocks.
      Returns:
      true if at least one component tile in the grid contains good blocks, false otherwise.

    • getEngineStrength

      public int getEngineStrength()
      Calculates and returns the total engine strength based on the components available and additional conditions like the presence of a brown alien.
      Returns:
      the total calculated engine strength as an integer

    • getCannonStrength

      public double getCannonStrength()
      Calculates and returns the total cannon strength based on the component tiles present and other conditions. The method aggregates the cannon strength values from all present component tiles and applies additional strength if certain conditions, such as the presence of a purple alien, are met.
      Returns:
      the total cannon strength as a double value

    • isBrownAlienPresent

      public boolean isBrownAlienPresent()
      Checks if a brown alien is present within the component tiles grid.
      Returns:
      true if a brown alien is present, false otherwise.

    • isPurpleAlienPresent

      public boolean isPurpleAlienPresent()
      Checks if a purple alien is present within the component tiles grid. The method iterates through each component tile in the grid. For each tile, it checks if the tile contains an alien with the specified color "purple".
      Returns:
      true if a purple alien is found in any of the tiles, false otherwise.

    • isConnectedToCabin

      public boolean isConnectedToCabin(int row, int col) throws RuntimeException
      Checks if the specified tile, identified by its row and column coordinates, is connected to a cabin in the componentTilesGrid. A tile is considered connected to a cabin if one of its adjacent tiles is a cabin and their matching sides align.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the tile to check
      col - the column index of the tile to check
      Returns:
      true if the tile is connected to a cabin, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if no tile is found at the specified location

    • removeMostValuableGoodBlocks

      public void removeMostValuableGoodBlocks(int num)
      Removes the most valuable good blocks up to the specified number. The method attempts to remove red blocks first, followed by yellow, green, and blue blocks, in that order of priority. If the specified number is still not reached, it attempts to remove batteries from component tiles until the desired number or all available resources are removed.
      Parameters:
      num - the maximum number of good blocks to be removed, starting from the most valuable ones.

    • getCosmicCredits

      public int getCosmicCredits()
      Retrieves the current amount of cosmic credits.
      Returns:
      the number of cosmic credits as an integer

    • addCosmicCredits

      public void addCosmicCredits(int credit)
      Adds the specified amount of cosmic credits to the current balance.
      Parameters:
      credit - the amount of cosmic credits to be added

    • isAlienPlaceable

      public boolean isAlienPlaceable(int i, int j, String color)
      Determines if an alien can be placed on the specified tile based on its position and the given color. This checks the current tile conditions, the presence of an alien with the same color, and adjacency rules.
      Parameters:
      i - the row index of the tile in the grid
      j - the column index of the tile in the grid
      color - the color associated with the alien to be placed
      Returns:
      true if the alien can be placed on the specified tile, false otherwise

    • getCrewNumber

      public int getCrewNumber()

    • setFinishedShipboard

      public void setFinishedShipboard(boolean finishedShipboard)
      Sets the status of whether the shipboard process is finished.
      Parameters:
      finishedShipboard - a boolean value indicating if the shipboard process is completed.

    • isFinishedShipboard

      public boolean isFinishedShipboard()
      Checks if the shipboard process is completed.
      Returns:
      true if the shipboard process is finished, false otherwise

    • highlightShipWrecks

      public int highlightShipWrecks()
      Highlights shipwrecks on the grid by grouping connected tiles and assigning different colors to each group. The method iterates over all the tiles in the grid, colors uncolored tiles, and propagates the color to connected tiles forming distinct groups.
      Returns:
      the total number of distinct colors used to highlight the shipwreck groups.

    • chooseShipWreck

      public void chooseShipWreck(int i, int j)
      Selects a shipwreck based on the specified coordinates and removes all shipwrecks of a different color from the grid.
      Parameters:
      i - the row index of the grid where the shipwreck is to be chosen
      j - the column index of the grid where the shipwreck is to be chosen
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no shipwreck is present at the specified coordinates

    • getComponentTileFromGrid

      public Optional<ComponentTile> getComponentTileFromGrid(int i, int j)
      Retrieves a ComponentTile from the grid at the specified grid coordinates.
      Parameters:
      i - the row index within the grid
      j - the column index within the grid
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the ComponentTile at the specified grid coordinates, or an empty Optional if no tile exists at the given location

    • getOnlyHumanNumber

      public int getOnlyHumanNumber()
      Calculates and returns the total number of humans present in the component tiles grid. A human is determined by the absence of specific alien types ("brown" and "purple") in a tile.
      Returns:
      the total number of humans across the component tiles grid

    • isAbandoned

      public boolean isAbandoned()
      Checks if the current object is marked as abandoned.
      Returns:
      true if the object is marked as abandoned, false otherwise

    • deactivateAllComponent

      public void deactivateAllComponent()
      Deactivates all components present in the ship that utilize a battery. This method iterates through the collection of component tiles and, for each non-empty tile, triggers the deactivation of the respective component. The deactivation process is executed only for tiles that are not empty, ensuring that no null components are accessed.

    • setTileInHand

      public void setTileInHand(ComponentTile componentTile)
      Sets the current tile in hand to the specified ComponentTile. If a tile is already in hand, it throws an IllegalStateException to prevent holding more than one tile at a time.
      Parameters:
      componentTile - the ComponentTile to be set as the tile currently in hand, or null to clear the tile in hand.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if a tile is already in hand and the specified componentTile is not null.

    • getTileInHand

      public ComponentTile getTileInHand()
      Retrieves the tile currently held in hand.
      Returns:
      the tile currently in hand as a ComponentTile object

    • allCabinsArePopulated

      public boolean allCabinsArePopulated()
      Checks if all cabins in the component tile grid have been populated with crew members. This method iterates over the list of tiles in the grid, identifying whether the tile is a cabin and verifying if it has at least one crew member assigned to it. If any cabin is found to have no crew members, the method returns false. If all cabins are populated, it returns true.
      Returns:
      true if all cabins in the grid are populated with at least one crew member; false otherwise

    • getDiscardedTiles

      public int getDiscardedTiles()
      Retrieves the number of discarded tiles.
      Returns:
      the count of discarded tiles as an integer

    • setRocketPlaced

      public void setRocketPlaced(boolean rocketPlaced)
      Sets the status indicating whether the rocket has been placed.
      Parameters:
      rocketPlaced - a boolean value where true indicates the rocket has been placed, and false indicates it has not been placed

    • isRocketPlaced

      public boolean isRocketPlaced()
      Checks if the rocket has been placed successfully.
      Returns:
      true if the rocket is placed, false otherwise

    • setCorrectingShip

      public void setCorrectingShip(boolean correctingShip)
      Sets the correctingShip flag to indicate whether the ship is being corrected.
      Parameters:
      correctingShip - the new state of the correctingShip flag; true if the ship is being corrected, false otherwise

    • isCorrectingShip

      public boolean isCorrectingShip()
      Determines whether the ship is currently in the process of correcting its course.
      Returns:
      true if the ship is correcting its course, false otherwise.
